shortcontents.shortcontent: [The continuation of the text in AMM-005]: I) Täʾamrä ʾIyäsus “Miracles of Jesus”: 34 (?) miracles (fols. 1ra-108vb), incomplete.

donors.donor: The name of the original female donor has been erased throughout the Ms., but can be discerned on some fols. as Rǝgbä Dawit (e.g., fols. 4rb, 31vb, 51va, 82rb, 93va, 95vb). Also the names of the donor's father, ʾAmdä Maryam and the donor's mother, Wälättä Ḥawaryat, have been preserved (e.g., fols. 39ra, 68vb, 82rb, 103rb). Their names were partly replaced with those of Dagǝmawi Zä-Mänfäs Qǝddus and his wife ʿAmätä Dǝngǝl (in strong amaranth ink, e.g., fols. 25ra, 34vb, 35rb, 36ra, 42vb, 51va, 57rb, 59ra, 79ra), occasionally with that of Haftä (sic) Gäbrǝʾel and Wälättä Mädḫǝn (in strong vermillion and black ink, e.g, fols. 1ra, 16vb, 30vb).

dcomments.dcomment: Mid-18th - early 19th cent. (?) Dagǝmawi Zä-Mänfäs Qǝddus might be identified with Ḫagos (d. 1831), the second son of däğğazmač Subagadis (1770-1831) whose baptismal name was Zä-Mänfäs Qǝddus. The identification is based on Additiones 1 and 2 in Ms. FBM-002.

txstates.txstate: The beginning of the text is in AMM-005, with no loss of text in between. Many fols. are affected by humidity, occasionally blurred ink. Holes or tears amended on fols. 88, 90, 91.

bindings.binding: Two wooden boards (the back board is missing). Two pairs of sewing stations.

bnothers.bnother: Small holes are visible on the spine fold of some quires, close to the head and the tail of the codex.

inks.ink: Black, red (brilliant scarlet, strong amaranth, strong vermillion).

squires.squire: I(10/fols. 1r-10v) – II(10; s.l.: 4, stub after 7; 7, stub after 4/fol. 11r-20v) – III(4/fols. 21r-24v) – IV(8; s.l.: 3, stub after 5; 6, stub after 2/fols. 25r-32v) – V(8/fols. 33-40v) – VI(8/fols. 41r-48v) – VII(8; s.l.: 4, stub after 5; 5, stub after 4/fols. 49r-56v) – VIII(8/fols. 57r-64v) – IX(8/fols. 65r-72v) – X(8/fols. 73r-80v) – XI(6/fols. 81r-86v) – XII(8/fols. 87r-94v) – XIII(8/fols. 95r-102v) – XIV(6/fols. 103r-108v).

taunit.rl-info: Ruling and pricking are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are partly visible. Ruling pricks are partly visible. The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.

pchangeofhands.pchangeofhand: The handwriting tends to left-sloping; it appears very irregular due to the variations in ruling (the size of the columns and the space between lines often differs significantly: e.g., fols. 23v, 89rv, 92r, 100r), changes of the pen nib (slender or broad nib: e.g. fols. 32v against 33r, 83v against 84; within one column: e.g., fols. 29rb, 32ra, 37vb, 102ra), changes in letters' height, and varying spaces between the letters.

rubrications.rubrication: Rubrication of the main text is executed in brilliant red. Nomina sacra; names of the original donors (but mostly erased); incipit of sections and subsections; word mǝʿǝraf (fol. 109rb); elements of the punctuation signs; elements of Ethiopic numerals. Names of other donors, added (later) in a secondary hand, are written in strong amaranth and strong vermillion.

otherdetails.otherdetail: The beginning of the Ms. was photographed separately and given the signature AMM-005 as the codex has been preserved as two separate units. The entire Ms. comprises 160 fols. with 49 (?) miracles of Jesus.

extras.extra: - The name(s) of the original donor(s), mentioned throughout the Ms., have been erased and partly replaced with other names in a secondary hand. - Omissions inserted interlineally: e.g., fols. 3vb, 27vb, 38va, 99ra. - Corrections written over erased words: e.g., fols. 12vb, 39vb, 43va, 54ra, 99ra. - Immediate corrections indicated by a line encircling the words: fols. 30rb, 34rb. - Most of the erasures are marked with parallel lines: fol. 71vb. - Trinitarian formula: fol. 108vb

txfindingaids.txfindingaid: - Notes in the upper margins in a secondary hand, in pencil, indicating the readings for church feasts and other occasions: fols. 91ra, 92ra, 93ra, 93va, 95vb.
